content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at Position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Cable input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• Burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5)
• Secondary burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
• Assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)

### Depot Belt System at Position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Wooden chest (belt depot) at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
• Transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5)
• Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5)

### Extraction System at Position (-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
• Extraction system burner inserter at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5) with drop position at Position(x=-3.5, y=28.5)

ERROR TIPS
────────────
• Belt Connection Errors:
  – When connecting transport belts, the target must be a valid inserter rather than a Prototype.SteamEngine. Always use an intermediary inserter to input items into the steam engine.

• Entity Placement Errors:
  – If receiving a “target position is too far” error (e.g. at (3.5,15.5)), ensure the player moves close enough to the intended position before placing.
  – A “No wooden_chest in inventory” error indicates that the required item isn’t available; verify inventory contents before attempting placement.

• Variable Definition Errors:
  – A NameError such as “target_chest is not defined” calls for checking that all variables are properly defined and consistently referenced before use.
